page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: The area to the north of Butterleigh village is a hilly rural area with lots of fields and farms close together.It seems to be isolated but it is within easy reach of main roads to Exeter,Tiverton and Cullompton.There are narrow winding lanes everywhere. Butterleigh village is very small and because it has no obvious tourist attractions it is not on the tourist map.(Unlike Bickleigh 3 miles away on the Exeter to Tiverton Road which attracts coachloads of tourists.)This means that although the countryside around is beautiful it is mainly enjoyed by the inhabitants and other local people. Most of the people work on the land.The main source of income locally is through {Dairy Farming}.There is a lot of grassland and this is probably
